alert.note: Alert for Armstrong; Gray (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 18 at 11:26PM CDT until May 19 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT FOR EASTERN ARMSTRONG...GRAY AND DONLEY COUNTIES... At 1125 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Pampa to Lefors to Alanreed to Howardwick to 16 miles west of Brice, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to roofs, siding, and trees is possible. Locations impacted include... Pampa, Clarendon, Mclean, Lefors, Howardwick, Hedley, Lelia Lake, Lake Mcclellan, Kingsmill, Alanreed, Greenbelt Lake and Goodnight. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
